Class DisplaySelect

  • java.lang.Object
    • DisplayableWindow
      • DisplaySelect

  • public class DisplaySelect
extends DisplayableWindow
    class DisplaySelect

    The window data and layout for the window of the menu to select the different layers to play.

    Version:
    0.4 (Kinda-Maybe done.)
    Author:
    Kaushik A. & Kevin C.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplaySelect

        public DisplaySelect(java.util.ArrayList<Level> levels)
        Constructor for Display Select

        Instantiates levels with parameter levels. Sets int fade to 60. Sets boolean fadeIn to true. float array hoverPhase recieves new float array of same size as levels ArrayList.

        Parameters:
        levels - the recieved ArrayList of Level objects.

      • DisplaySelect

        public DisplaySelect(Level... levels)
        Constructor for DisplaySelect

        Instantiates ArrayList levels containing Level objects.

        Parameters:
        levels - ArrayList or singular Level Object

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display(long window)
        Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses to do the actual rendering of the window.
        Specified by:
        display in class DisplayableWindow
        Parameters:
        window - The GLFWwindow pointer that holds the window's data. Needed to do any displaying.

      • doClick

        public void doClick(int clickType,
                    java.awt.Point location)
        When the user clicks a location on the window, this will be called. Warning: This is asynchronous, and can happen at any time, EVEN WHEN OTHER METHODS ARE INPROGRESS.
        Specified by:
        doClick in class DisplayableWindow
        Parameters:
        clickType - Enumeration of which mouse button was used to do the click. See GLFW.GLFW_MOUSE_BUTTON_1 through GLFW.GLFW_MOUSE_BUTTON_8
        location - The point on the screen that was clicked.

      • doDrag

        public void doDrag(java.awt.Point location)
        When the user clicks and holds, then moves the mouse, this will be called. Warning: This is asynchronous, and can happen at any time, EVEN WHEN OTHER METHODS ARE INPROGRESS. Not used within DisplaySelect
        Overrides:
        doDrag in class DisplayableWindow
        Parameters:
        location - The point on the screen where the mouse was moved to.

      • doRelease

        public void doRelease(int clickType,
                      java.awt.Point location)
        When the user clicks, then lets go, this will be called. Warning: This is asynchronous, and can happen at any time, EVEN WHEN OTHER METHODS ARE INPROGRESS.
        Specified by:
        doRelease in class DisplayableWindow
        Parameters:
        clickType - Enumeration of which mouse button was used to do the click. See GLFW.GLFW_MOUSE_BUTTON_1 through GLFW.GLFW_MOUSE_BUTTON_8
        location - The point on the screen where the mouse is, upon being released.

      • doScroll

        public void doScroll(boolean directionIsUp,
                     java.awt.Point location)
        Scroll is not used in DisplaySelect. Inherited from DisplayableWindow.
        Overrides:
        doScroll in class DisplayableWindow
        Parameters:
        directionIsUp - This will be true, if the scroll is upward.
        location - The point on the screen where the mouse is, when it is scrolled.
